page.title: 05Milk Quotas - Heathylee
page.content: The milk quota was introduced by the E.E.C. because there was too much milk. It is not liked because it means that the small farmers will be less well off than the larger farmers who had a bigger quota. We interviewed a farmer and he said that he had made the following changes of farming policy to cope with the effects of the quotas: 1. He has reduced his corn bill by rationing his cows. 2. He has joined the National Milk Records Scheme so that he can cull cows with low yields and poor butterfats and ration the others according to their yields. 3. He culls any animals that are wrong either in their udders or their feet, or any that are ill, to avoid vets' bills.
